data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text: We have eaten at Robbie's quite a few times so we went there Saturday to celebrate my birthday and Father's Day with some friends. The atmosphere in the restaurant is so personal it's hard to beat.  After dinner we were asking about desserts (not that we were hungry) but since it was my birthday I was asking if they had strawberry pie. They didn't so I was kidding them about not having it for my birthday.  We all sat and talked for awhile after dinner and all of the sudden they come out with a piece of strawberry pie with a candle in it for me.  They had snuck out and gotten a piece for me at a local place. To me, that goes way above and beyond normal everyday service and I will never forget it!!!  Thanks for making my birthday so special.

data.title: The first time I had Bernaise
data.text: My Dad and Suzanne lived in Decatur during the 80's and 90's. Robbies was the first place I learned to enjoy truly great food. They were always kind and gracious to the little kid, then little man. When I think of Decatur, Robbies is ALWAYS right at the top! I miss those times.

data.title: Where do I start?
data.text: While there were amazing smells coming from the restaurant, we unfortunately did not experience that first hand. My sea bass was terrible. I've never had fish that I had to struggle to cut with a steak knife! It wasn't seasoned. I wasn't cooked thoroughly. The waiter was smug... wearing flip flops and sunglasses on top of his head. McDonald's staff are better dressed and more professional. My husband and I refer to this as "the Dive in Decatur." We were both sadly disappointed, so much so that we will not return again.

data.title: Excellent food.
data.text: Great downtown restaurant with a simple menu but not simple flavors!!  Order the Grilled Cajun meatloaf.  It comes on a pile of mashed potatoes and gravy and will blow you away.  Their burgers are top notch and the stuffed green pepper soup is outstanding.  Always friendly service, and very affordable.

data.title: Always a favorite
data.text: My husband and I love to eat here on week nights whenever possible. We like the fact that it is small so it is not overly loud. The service is always personal and top notch.  The best part is that we have never had a bad meal here. As a side, the sugar snap peas are one of my favorites!   They have always been very accommodating with the menu too, being flexible in my book rates five stars.  The menu does change on Friday night which is not to our liking, but that's ok, we have four other nights to eat there during the week :)

data.title: Try the Grilled Cajun Meatloaf!
data.text:
We've been to Robbie's several times and have found the food to be good hearty Central Illinois fare. We especially like the lunches which feature a grilled cajun meatloaf. It comes with mashed potatoes and green beans and is far different from what Mom use to make. 
If you like spice that Bayou Shrimp is a treat. It is a bowl of shrimp, with a kick your butt sauce and a big ole hunk of garlic bread. YUM!

data.title: Best in Decatur
data.text: Good menu, best quality, always good service and pleasant atmosphere.  Lots of personal attention.  Would recommend to everyone.

data.title: Very nice cuisine.
data.text: Robbie's was always one of my favorite lunch getaways when I lived in Decatur. I always found it to be a pleasant escape with nice atmosphere and quality food. The menu is unique with gourmet dishes that change dailey. Never a bad meal, always a pleasant surprise. I miss not living in town. When I get back to Decatur, Robbie's in on my list of favorite places to eat.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Robbies is always a nice place to eat. The food is well prepared and the restaurant has a cozy atmoshpere.  I enjoy the Cajun meatloaf when I go there. There is a small, but nice selection on the menu.

data.title: What a great restaurant with awesome food selections and the best service!
data.text: This is one of the best local upscale restaurants in the area. I eat at Robbie's quite frequently and enjoy the extraordinary service while eating and/or drinking. I would recommend Robbie's to anyone wanting a great meal and a wonderful ambience.

data.title: Not bad at all
data.text: Spent a number of months in Decatur for work and this was one of the better food options in town.  Food is good, prices are reasonable...not the quickest service but nice enough if you can get their attention

data.title: An awesome find!
data.text: This was such a wonderful surprise to find!  Several of us attending a conference went here for dinner.  The service was excellent especially with each of us needing not only a separate check but a separate check for alcohol.  The food was different, fun, and tasty!  None of us were disappointed in our meals.  The only thing I would have liked to see if some sort of side dish addition included in the meal itself.

data.title: Not many selections and no private conversation
data.text: I like the food Robbie's offers, but the selection is very limited and the tables are so close together that a private conversation is totally impossible.  I have stopped going here because of this.

data.title: Our Decatur Favorite
data.text:
This has been our favorite restaurant in Decatur for at least 15 years.  The staff is attentive, friendly and funny.  The food is always perfect.  The atmosphere is friendly and perfect for intimate conversations as well as meeting up with old friends.

We love the Tonys, the salmon, the chili and of course, everyone loves Bloody Mary's with a snit on Saturdays.

Best restaurant in Decatur!

data.title: My favorite downtown restaurant!
data.text: Great food, great atmosphere!  I especially enjoy going for lunch as I work downtown.

data.title: A never fail place for a good drink and a great steak
data.text: Lately Robbies and the other businesses on Merchant Square have had some problems as they are rearranging downtown Decatur but it seems there are now sidewalks and streets so you can get into Merchants square.  Robbies always delivers great food and drink.  A staple of old Decatur

data.title: Steak and Drinks
data.text: I was on a business trip and this is a cozy place. We all got the evening's special which was steak served with "smashed" potatoes and asparagus. I would rate the steak as good, but the whole presentation and mix of favors were amazing. The drinks were great and they were not shy with liquor. I will make a point going back next time I'm in town.

data.title: Meatloaf
data.text: I had the grilled meatloaf.  Tasted good, large portion.  My first introduction to the word "toast point".  Don't be fooled it is regular bread toasted.

data.title: My husband and I love a...
data.text: My husband and I love a Friday evening at Robbie's. The atmosphere and food are spot on and unique from any other establishment in Decatur.

data.title: Great bistro experience!
data.text:
Robbie's on Merchant Street is a Decatur gem.  The restaurant is small, but has excellent food for dinner and lunch.  My wife and I often have the beefeater salad with balsamic vinaigrette and the wonderful thin-crust pizza.  Often, they have a great seafood special such as sea bass (one of my favorites) and sea scallops, and the value, in addition to the delicious flavor, is excellent.  A nice but small wine selection complements the menu nicely.

The space is small and intimate.  There are about 12 tables in a line, and an equally long bar with about 15 places.  The atmosphere is vibrant.

There are no reservations here, so there is occasionally a few-minute wait for a table.

The service is smart and attentive.

Great place.
